Sentencas: Anode-supported SOFC button cells with LSCF-6428 cathodes were operated at various temperatures under constant current conditions for hundreds of hours in dry or humid (similar to 3% water) cathode air while continuously collecting 1 hour XRD scans throughout the test duration.
Titulo: Evaluation of cation migration in lanthanum strontium cobalt ferrite solid oxide fuel cell cathodes via in-operando X-ray diffraction

Sentencas: Additionally, one cell in dry air was held at OCV, and 12% CO2 was added to the humid air for another cell.
Titulo: Evaluation of cation migration in lanthanum strontium cobalt ferrite solid oxide fuel cell cathodes via in-operando X-ray diffraction

Sentencas: Long cumulative XRD count times allowed minor phases in concentrations of less than 0.1 wt% to be identified.
Titulo: Evaluation of cation migration in lanthanum strontium cobalt ferrite solid oxide fuel cell cathodes via in-operando X-ray diffraction

Sentencas: In humid air, cell performance increased during the first couple of hundred hours.
Titulo: Evaluation of cation migration in lanthanum strontium cobalt ferrite solid oxide fuel cell cathodes via in-operando X-ray diffraction

Sentencas: XRD measured a gradual shift of Fe-rich Fe,Co spinel peaks to lower angles while post-mortem SEM discovered nano-nodules on the LSCF surfaces.
Titulo: Evaluation of cation migration in lanthanum strontium cobalt ferrite solid oxide fuel cell cathodes via in-operando X-ray diffraction

Sentencas: When 12% CO2 was added to humid air, performance degradation was observed after the initial conditioning response, unlike in tests without CO2, which were stable after conditioning.
Titulo: Evaluation of cation migration in lanthanum strontium cobalt ferrite solid oxide fuel cell cathodes via in-operando X-ray diffraction

Sentencas: XRD also measured a shift in the peaks of the major LSCF phase in the test with CO2 indicative of some degree of gradual decomposition.
Titulo: Evaluation of cation migration in lanthanum strontium cobalt ferrite solid oxide fuel cell cathodes via in-operando X-ray diffraction

Sentencas: Cells tested at constant current in dry air exhibited fast initial degradation that decelerated over time, while the cell held at OCV maintained a stable voltage.
Titulo: Evaluation of cation migration in lanthanum strontium cobalt ferrite solid oxide fuel cell cathodes via in-operando X-ray diffraction

Sentencas: XRD of the cathodes held at OCV at 750 degrees C and operated at constant current at 700 degrees C in dry air measured a slower shift of the Fe-rich spinel peaks to lower angles than was seen in tests in humid air, along with a shift in the peaks of a Co-rich Fe, Co spinel to higher angles.
Titulo: Evaluation of cation migration in lanthanum strontium cobalt ferrite solid oxide fuel cell cathodes via in-operando X-ray diffraction

Sentencas: Post-mortem SEM of cells exposed to dry air discovered smaller nano-nodules on the LSCF surfaces than had been present in cells tested in humid air.
Titulo: Evaluation of cation migration in lanthanum strontium cobalt ferrite solid oxide fuel cell cathodes via in-operando X-ray diffraction

Sentencas: Cells tested at constant current in dry air at 750 degrees C and 800 degrees C did not exhibit any gradual changes in the XRD patterns nor were nano-nodules discovered.
Titulo: Evaluation of cation migration in lanthanum strontium cobalt ferrite solid oxide fuel cell cathodes via in-operando X-ray diffraction
